comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/joefuz] Indeed. He's keeping his head down, but his stance and swing could use some work :) (And those young fellas are standing in the worst/best possible place to get a t-box clobbering!) Still though - better dressed for it than I'll ever be :)

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: At the time  of the photo both the golf links and the racecourse were on the low lying reclaimed land behind the main beach in Tramore. The sea broke through the sea wall , i think in 1914 and drowned both the links and race course which were both rebuilt in locations higher up in the town in later years. Brownstown head is in the background in the photo

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/63844591@N04] Thanks! Have moved the location to behind the main beach...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
